User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110930134335

Steps to reproduce:

Using bugzilla-3.6.6-1.fc15.noarch and testopia-2.4-BUGZILLA-3.6.tar.gz, patched using the provided extensions/Testopia/patch-3.6.2

Bugzilla works fine, and I can configure Testopia. But clicking Product Dashboard or New Plan gets me an Internal Server Error page. 





Actual results:

In the specific case of going from the home page to New Case, the httpd error_log shows:

(13)Permission denied: exec of '/usr/share/bugzilla/tr_new_case.cgi' failed, referer: http://naslinux1/bugzilla/index.cgi

Premature end of script headers: tr_new_case.cgi, referer: http://naslinux1/bugzilla/index.cgi

I have googled for common fixes for "premature end of script" and believe I've checked every common issue. The .cgi files are rwxr-x--- root apache. All the dirs are ditto, except for a few which I made that way, and it didn't help.  checksetup.pl runs fine. I can create Bugzilla bugs and search for them. A "Testers" group exists and I marked myself in it. I have all the testopia settings at the values which are used in a working testopia (that someone else is running with Bugzilla 3.4). I tried putting 'print STDERR "foo\n";' (or something like that) as the second line of the cgi script, and nothing changed, implying that the named script is in fact not being run, meaning that the issue is external to it.



Expected results:

Should have got a Dashboard or Plan web page. If there is eg a bad parameter setting that is being detected, then the error message really should say which one it is (or in some other way narrow the problem space).

comments.text:
I have a fix, although I think it reveals something.

My Apache came set up for /var/www/html, and my Bugzilla RPM installed itself in /usr/share/bugzilla. So my original setup just put a symlink in /var/www. I "fixed" Testopia by editing httpd.conf, changing all mentions of /var/www/html into /usr/share/bugzilla. 

I am guessing that some Testopia intermodule handoff tried to go directly to a place in /usr/share without going through the symlink, and httpd disallowed it. At least, that seems like a reasonable assumption, given the trivial change I made.

So maybe the Testopia install page should warn about that, or, the scripts might use a different coding style to access .cgi's.
